about_the_game:
Gabenwood need you! A mad and evil scientist once again tries to destroy the parallel Universe. These time he stole from our world dollars, polish zloty and alphabet letters. You will go across continent to find all anomalies.

It is a fun for all family which will help you develop your attention and memory as well.

Play with your kids, find all anomalies, and guess which countries and sightseeing of our world was an inspiration for Gabenwood.

Disclaimer:
The story, all names, characters, and incidents portrayed in this production are fictitious. No identification with actual persons (living or deceased), places, buildings, and products is intended or should be inferred.

Features:
* hidden objects puzzle.
* simple control by mouse.
* relaxing gameplay.
* hand drawn locations with sightseeing from across the world.
* game suited for all ages.
* achievements.

name: Gabenwood 2: 99 Hidden Euros

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7, 10, 11 (x64)
  • Processor: Intel Celeron 2000 MHz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.3 graphics card with at least 512MB of video memory
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

short_description: New challenges for the fan of hidden object puzzles! Be our hero! Go to the parallel Universe and find all anomaly to save the Gabenwood from destruction!
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Arabic, Bulgarian, Portuguese - Brazil, Hungarian, Vietnamese, Greek, Danish, Indonesian, Spanish - Latin America, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, Korean, Dutch, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese - Portugal, Romanian, Russian, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian, Finnish, Czech, Swedish, Japanese, Azerbaijani, Albanian, Amharic, Armenian, Assamese, Afrikaans, Basque, Belarusian, Bangla, Bosnian, Valencian, Welsh, Wolof, Galician, Georgian, Gujarati, Dari, Zulu, Hebrew, Igbo, Irish, Icelandic, Yoruba, Kazakh, Kannada, Catalan, Quechua, Kinyarwanda, K'iche', Konkani, Xhosa, Khmer, Kyrgyz, Latvian, Lithuanian, Luxembourgish, Macedonian, Malay, Malayalam, Maltese, Maori, Marathi, Mongolian, Nepali, Odia, Punjabi (Gurmukhi), Punjabi (Shahmukhi), Persian, Serbian, Sotho, Sinhala, Sindhi, Slovak, Slovenian, Sorani, Swahili, Tajik, Tamil, Tatar, Telugu, Tigrinya, Tswana, Turkmen, Uzbek, Uyghur, Urdu, Filipino, Hausa, Hindi, Croatian, Cherokee, Scots, Estonian
